column6: Although no specific mention has been seen for this species, many other members of this genus are said to be poisonous, causing paralysis[74].
column8: W. Europe, including Britain, from Denmark to Germany and Spain.
column16: Galeopsis segetum is a ANNUAL growing to 0.6 m (2ft).  It is in flower from July to October. The species is hermaphrodite (has both male and female organs) and is pollinated by Bees. The plant is self-fertile.  Suitable for: light (sandy), medium (loamy) and heavy (clay) soils. Suitable pH: mildly acid, neutral and basic (mildly alkaline) soils. It can grow in  semi-shade (light woodland) or no shade. It prefers  moist soil.
column20: Astringent: Produces contraction in living tissue, reducing the flow of secretions and discharges of blood, mucus, diarrhoea etc.,Diuretic: Acts on the kidneys, promoting the flow of urine.,Expectorant: Clears phlegm from the chest by inducing coughing.,Homeopathy: A plant used in homeopathic treatments.
column21: Plants For A Future can not take any responsibility for any adverse effects from the use of plants. Always seek advice from a professional before using a plant medicinally.Astringent  Diuretic  Expectorant  HomeopathyThe flowering plant is astringent, diuretic and mildly expectorant[9]. A decoction has been used in the treatment of whooping cough, bronchitis, tracheitis etc[9]. The plant is harvested in the summer and can be used fresh or dried[9]. A homeopathic remedy is made from the plant[9]. It is used to treat disorders of the spleen[9].
column25: Grows in most soils, disliking heavy shade. This plant is sometimes grown in the wild garden[200].
column26: Seed - sow spring in situ[200]. Germination usually takes place within a month.
